WRITING.TEXT: Japanquest is an experience...especially in venues with abnormally low ceilings.
They're just awful. I've seen them 9 times, just to make sure.
I have a video of them taking shots but that's about it, ha!
If no ones answers, try posting this again closer to the date of the concert. I'm sure people will know their plans by then!

WRITING.TITLE: THE OPERA HOUSE, TORONTO (Jan 14, 2017) - Tickets For "Ladyworld" EP Release Party (19+)
THE REGENT, LA (Jan 27, 2017) - Tickets for "Ladyworld" EP Release Party

WRITING.TEXT:
Nah, a lot of people are on the same page as you and I think you made your point quite civilly.
On one hand, a lot of us are absolutely thankful to NSP/GG for introducing us to TWRP, because that's the reason a lot of us are here. On the other hand, (I can't speak for everyone but) I don't think many TWRP fans like them *because* they collaborate together.
They're an awesome combination, for sure, but the whole "mega band" schtick is beginning to lose it's magic. That's not to say I won't support them no matter what they choose to do :0 This EP already sounds incredible and I'll continue enjoying them even if NSP is on every track; but yes, I can definitely see where you're coming from!
Yep! I believe Danny even posted a teaser of it on his instagram.

WRITING.TITLE: New TWRP EP announced ft. NSP (x-post r/TWRP)

WRITING.TEXT: Pretty sure this is a teaser for the new TWRP/NSP collab actually. So yeah, definitely the same music!
Am I to expect this kind of lead up every time a new EP comes out because if so...*end me.*
Is that David Tennant I hear?

WRITING.TITLE: Do you know what this means?

WRITING.TEXT: Sorry the audio on my phone is awful, but I thought people would be amused to see TWRP performing a different song with an astronaut!

WRITING.TITLE: Chris Hadfield ft. TWRP - Taking Care of Business (Generator 2016 @ Massey Hall)
